meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - I'm back with another review that's faster than your average raccoon on a Red Bull-fueled caffeine high!

I just got my hands on Horizon Chase 2, and I must say, it's a real speed demon! But don't just take my word for it; let's see what the other critics have to say.

Gaming Nexus gives it a 65, saying it's "not enough to compensate for relatively mindless racing." Ouch, burn! Sounds like they wanted more substance from this arcade racer. Fair enough, but I think it's still a fun ride.

Push Square scores it 70, praising the online multiplayer and rotating challenges that keep things fresh. Yeah, online multiplayer is always a winner, especially if you're one of those speedsters who loves to compete with others!

Now, onto the heavy hitters! PlayStation Universe gives Horizon Chase 2 a whopping 90, calling it "phenomenal" and saying it's the definitive arcade racing experience. That's high praise indeed!

GameSpew agrees, awarding it an 80 and saying it's bigger and better than its predecessor in every way. I mean, who doesn't love a good sequel?

Impulsegamer also gives it an 80, stating that Horizon Chase 2 is the template for what a sequel should be. That's some serious kudos!

Lastly, IGN Spain scores it an 80 as well, calling it "classic" and "beautiful." I think they're onto something with the whole classic vibe thing!

And then there's Player 2, who gives it a 67, saying it's blisteringly fast but lacks energy in its audio mixing. Hmmm, might be a bit of a downer for those looking for some serious ear-candy.

So, what's my verdict? Well, let me put it this way: Horizon Chase 2 is like that one friend who's always up for a good time â€“ fast-paced, fun, and a little bit crazy! You know, the kind of friend you want to hang out with, but not take too seriously. It might not be perfect, but hey, sometimes that's exactly what we need: a light-hearted, high-speed romp to shake off those Monday blues!

That's it for now, folks! If you're looking for some speedy fun and don't mind a bit of simplicity, Horizon Chase 2 is the way to go. And remember, if you're not having fun, you're doing it wrong!
